tweet: We are engaging in harmful behavior - seismic testing - just to find ways to engage in other bad behavior - offshore drilling. #ProtectOurCoast
Seismic testing, creating the loudest man-made sounds in the ocean, can disturb and even harm whales, turtles, dolphins and fish.
We cannot prioritize polluters’ profits over our oceans. #ProtectOurCoast
President Trump and his cabinet officials have given these companies the green light to destroy wild life and fisheries without concern.
Offshore drilling in the Atlantic clearly panders to the corporations who stand to gain at the expense of the American people. #ProtectOurCoast

Seismic testing leads to offshore drilling, which can cause environmental disasters like #DeepwaterHorizon resulting in millions of gallons of oil spilling into our waters tarnishing marine life and coastal communities.
Coastal communities are united in fierce opposition to offshore drilling. I stand with my constituents who say no drilling off our coasts.
The Trump Administration’s nonchalant dismissal of #climatechange coupled with granting permits for seismic testing, action that leads to offshore drilling, is beyond alarming.
Issuing permits for seismic testing in the Atlantic Ocean puts our coastal businesses, fishing communities, eco-tourism, and our national security at risk. #ProtectOurCoast
The risks of allowing seismic testing and offshore drilling in the Atlantic Ocean are too grave. I am committed to do all I can to #protectourcoast. pic.twitter.com/HoqbUVi5MW
Here’s my official statement on the Trump Administration’s announcement to open the Atlantic Ocean up for seismic testing. pic.twitter.com/Vsm7zzZvOT
For the future of our earth, for our children and grandchildren, we have no more time and no other choice. #ActOnClimate
Weakening the rules governing vehicular and power plant emissions threaten public health. It is that simple. We must #actonclimate; not ignore science.
Not only does @realDonaldTrump and his cabinet ignore these findings but  they actively work to move us backward by eliminating necessary regulations and encouraging their dirty energy agenda.
In my congressional district, we face effects of climate change such as sea-level rise which jeopardizes homes, communities, and military operations.
We must treat each fact-based climate science report like the roadmap that it is.
More severe and frequent natural disasters prove this report points to the urgency of addressing climate change.

Three hundred scientists at 13 federal agencies worked to compile this comprehensive report detailing the dangers of climate change and the urgency of addressing this critical issue.  http://bit.ly/2P6Pu7x

Seismic airgun blasting and offshore drilling pose a serious threat of irreparable damage to public health, local economy, and marine life. I vehemently oppose this administration’s decision to open the Atlantic to drilling.
#BREAKING: The Trump Administration approved seismic testing in the Atlantic Ocean. This is simply irresponsible and dangerous.  https://wapo.st/2AMiM6D
I am looking forward to working with Chair-elect @RepKarenBass as the newly-elected Whip of the @OfficialCBC in the 116th Congress to advance legislation that makes a difference #forthepeople.
Research shows us that #climatechange is threatening America’s crop production and food security. We cannot ignore the facts. We must #actonclimate. https://bloom.bg/2P7SyAu
#ICYMI: Here is a link to the @OfficialCBC's powerful letter opposing the confirmation of Thomas Farr to a lifetime position on the federal bench in North Carolina:  http://bit.ly/2zWAW57  #StopFarr
Given his record, I have little confidence that Mr. Farr would administer justice fairly and impartially. We must #protectourcourts.

Our judiciary is foundational to the stability and success of our democracy. For our system to retain the confidence of the people, judges must be impartial, both in substance and appearance, and maintain a commitment to the dignity of all Americans. #StopFarr

Some of my constituents live in areas vulnerable to flooding. We need to know how the @EPA plans to incorporate lessons learned and other changes to the planning, protocols, and staffing ahead of the 2019 storm season.

The @EPA must inform the American people about their capacity and specific efforts to respond to the heightened and foreseeable environmental and public health risks natural disasters pose to lower-income communities and communities of color.
That is why @RepJayapal, @RepBarragan, and I led 40+ colleagues in asking @EPA for an update on their planning and response to natural disasters. pic.twitter.com/U7smhTr51s
FACT: We have yet to come across any information that would suggest that the @EPA learned from Hurricanes Harvey, Irma, and Maria and applied those lessons to improve preparation and response.
FACT: Natural disasters have a disproportionate impact on low-income communities & communities of color who are more likely to live in low-lying communities.
We have experienced a series of catastrophic hurricanes, wildfires, and tropical storms.

No one should fear for their safety because of the color of their skin,  their religion, their country of origin, or who they love. Already had coverage through  http://HealthCare.gov  for 2018? Do not forget to compare options for 2019! The deadline to enroll is 12/15/2018.

Do you need help going through the process to #GetCovered on  http://healthcare.gov ? Don’t worry – free help is available. You can call 1-800-318-2596 for help or visit  https://Localhelp.HealthCare.gov  to find free in-person assistance in your area.
Signing up for health coverage can be less expensive than you think. You can shop around until December 15th for coverage that will begin on January 1, 2019.
Did you know that 8 out of 10 people can #getcovered for less than $75 per month on the #ACA Marketplace?
FACT:  Most people who signed up for 2018 coverage on  http://HealthCare.gov  received financial help. Open enrollment starts today! #GetCovered #ACA
ACA Marketplace open enrollment starts TODAY, November 1st. Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered!  http://bit.ly/1dn07dY
